Event.name: Installing
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> places a <fen>Component</fen> in a <fen>Fixed_location</fen> so that the <fen>Component</fen> is attached and interconnected and thereby functional.
<ex>Displays were given an overhaul in the 1950s, with <fex name="Component">canopies</fex> <t>installed</t> <fex name="fix">above the Christmas counters</fex> <fex name="pur">to allow calendar and gift bows to be displayed</fex>. <fex name="Agent">CNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="loc">At the street</fex> <fex name="Component">an 8'' culvert</fex> will be <t>installed</t> <fex name="fix">under the driveway</fex>. <fex name="Agent">CNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="fix">In the space where the piano was, right next to the washing machine,</fex> <fex name="Agent">my grandmother</fex> <t>installed</t> <fex name="Component">her first dryer</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Agent">My handyman</fex> <t>installed</t> <fex name="Component">it</fex> <fex name="Time">yesterday</fex> and then I sort of forgot about it. </ex>
<ex>Now Marvin Odum, InterGen's Chief Executive Officer, has committed to moving up <t>installation</t> <fex name="Component">of the pollution control technology</fex> on its two other turbines.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person (or other force) that installs the <fen>Component</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agt">John</fex> <t>installed</t> it last night on my Gentoo system and everything is going fine so far.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Component
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Component</fen> is the object that is placed in a <fen>Fixed_location</fen>.
<ex>My plumber <t>installed</t> <fex name="com">the shower pan</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Location_of_protagonist
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This frame element specifies the location of the <fen>Agent</fen> (or of parts of their body) in cases where the <fen>Agent</fen> cannot manipulate the <fen>Component</fen> in straightforward fashion during the installation.
<ex>The front was easy for me to install, I held the bar and bolt in place from below and <t>installed</t> the nut <fex name="loc">from the top around the control arm bushing</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Fixed_location
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Fixed_location</fen> is the location where the <fen>Component</fen> is placed and to which it is attached so as to be useful.
<ex>I assembled the fuel tank using a vent line and a supply line, and then I <t>installed</t> the tank <fex name="fix">in the fuselage</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the installation event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Agent that affect the action (<ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>, <ment>carefully</ment>). </def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> indicates the degree to which the installation is completed.
<ex>Is the riser complete at the point the stab fittings are complete or when the fittings are complete and the riser is <fex name="Degree">completely</fex> <t>installed</t> in the bracket with the bolts tightened?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Component</fen> that is installed.
<ex>We delivered and <t>installed</t> it <fex name="Dep">unfinished</fex> because the customers wanted to finish it themselves.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> is an act whereby the <fen>Agent</fen> achieves the installation of the <fen>Component</fen>.
<ex>We <t>installed</t> the spindle assembly <fex name="Means">by starting with the lower-ball joint, followed by the upper</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration_of_final_state
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Duration_of_final_state</fen> is the amount of time for which the <fen>Component</fen> is to remain part of the System.
<ex>Per the suggestion of A. Briggs Geddis, Mr. McChord informed the Commission that a curtain drain could be <t>installed</t> and monitored <fex name="dur">for two months</fex> to try to lower the groundwater level in the proposed septic area.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the installation occurs.
<ex>When I <t>installed</t> the server <fex name="Place">there</fex> last winter they only had two rows of racks, mostly empty.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> indicates why the installation occurs.
<ex>I <t>installed</t> a new HDD <fex name="exp">because it had numerous bad sectors</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time period in which the <fen>Component</fen> is installed.
<ex>When we <t>installed</t> our hood <fex name="Time">last month</fex>, the folks at Dallas Auto Body painted our roll pan at the same time.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Area
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Area</fen> is the setting into which multiple <fen>Component</fen>s or a complex <fen>Component</fen> is installed. <ex>I <t>installed</t> tongue and groove pine flooring <fex name="Area">through my entire house</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Co-participant
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This is a second component that is installed alongside the primary <fen>Component</fen> or an individual performing the installation together with the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex>The Hewlett Packard 5989A MS Engine was <t>installed</t> in 1991 <fex name="Co-participant">together with the Hewlett Packard 5890 Series II Gas Chromatography (GC/MS)</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Agent</fen> intends to accomplish by perform the installation.
<ex>North Johnston High School <t>installed</t> many technologies <fex name="pur">in order to dramatically improve the energy efficiency of our building</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: install.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place or fix (equipment) in position ready for use.

lexUnit.name: installation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or process of installing or being installed
